data.title: Coat-of-Arms with Lion and Rooster
data.meta_description: The Coat of Arms with the Cock by Albrecht Durer (1471-1528); engraving
data.meta_site_name: Victoria and Albert Museum: Explore the Collections
data.text:
Physical description

Engraving print on paper; inscribed with artistâs monogram. A cockerel perches atop a helmet which is in turn balanced on a shield. The cock has his wings outspread and his beak open in a triumphant or warning crow. Beneath him, elaborate streams of acanthus foliage or pennants twist, swirl and spiral forth from the helmet to either side of the shield in a virtuoso display of ornamental design. The shield bears a heraldic emblem of a semi-naturalistic rampant lion with a fierce expression and claws extended.
